extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA (including small RNAs) was extracted using Trizol (Invitrogen) and the aqueous phase was purified with RNeasy Mini kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturers protocols.
growth_protocol_ch1: HEK293T cells were grown in DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS and 1X PSG.
hyb_protocol: The cRNA products were fragmented to 200 nucleotides or less, heated at 99 degrees C for 5 min and hybridized for 16 h at 45 degrees C. The microarrays were then washed at low (6X SSPE) and high (100mM MES, 0.1M NaCl) stringency and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin. Fluorescence was amplified by adding biotinylated anti-streptavidin and an additional aliquot of streptavidin-phycoerythrin stain.
label_protocol_ch1: Second-strand cDNA synthesis was followed by in vitro transcription for linear amplification of each transcript and incorporation of biotinylated CTP and UTP.
scan_protocol: A confocal scanner was used to collect fluorescence signal at 3um resolution after excitation at 570 nm. The average signal from two sequential scans was calculated for each microarray feature.
title: HEK293T_miR-381_FSK4hr_rep2
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cells were reverse transfected with RNA using Lipofectamine2000 at a final concentration of 50 nM.  Approximately 72hrs post-transfection, cells were treated with 15uM forskolin for 0, 1 or 4 hrs.

refinebio_platform: Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array (hgu133plus2)
contact_institute: U.S. Army Medical Research Institute of Chemical Defense
data_processing: Raw signal intensities were imported into Partek Genomics Solutions v6.5 (Partek, St. Louis, MO) and normalized using the robust multi-array averaging (RMA) algorithm.
description: Gene expression data from NHEK_080730 NM exposure 400 uM_8h timepoint
extract_protocol_ch1: Cell lysates were collected in 400uL 1% beta-mercaptoethanol in RLT lysis buffer and processed through QIAshredder columns (QIAGEN, Valencia, CA) per the manufacturer's instructions.  Total RNA was extracted and DNase I-treated using the RNeasy Mini Kit and RNase-Free DNase Set (QIAGEN) according to the manufacturers protocol.  The quantity and quality of the RNA was determined with a NanoDrop ND-1000 UV-vis spectrophotometer (Thermo Scientific, Wilmington, DE) and an Agilent bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA) throughout sample processing.
growth_protocol_ch1: Normal human epidermal keratinocytes (NHEK) (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were seeded at a density of 1.2 x103 cells per cm2 in 25 cm2 flasks, and grown to approximately 80 % confluency.  Cells were fed 24 hours prior to exposure with appropriate amount of media for final exposure concentration volume.  Cells were grown at 37C with 5% CO2.
hyb_protocol: Spike controls were added to 15 g fragmented cRNA before hybridization (36h) using 10 g of cRNA.  Arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin before being scanned on an Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner.
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was processed for hybridization to GeneChip Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 oligonucleotide arrays (Affymetrix, Inc., Santa Clara, CA) using the BioArray Single-Round RNA Amplification and Biotin Labeling System (Enzo Life Sciences, Inc., Farmingdale, NY).  In brief, 10 g of total RNA was used to generate first strand cDNA by using a T7-linked oligo(dT) primer.  After second strand synthesis, in vitro transcription was performed with biotinylated UTP and CTP for cRNA amplification.
scan_protocol: After scanning, array images were assessed by eye to confirm scanner alignment and the absence of significant bubbles or scratches on the chip surface. The 3'/5' ratios for GAPDH and B-actin were checked for quality. BioB, BioC, BioD and CreX spike controls were also examined to determine sample quality. All arrays were scaled to a target intensity of 150 using Affymetrix GeneChip Operating System (GCOS) software.
title: NHEK_080730 NM exposure 400 uM_8h timepoint
treatment_protocol_ch1: On the day of exposure 1M stocks of either mechlorethamine hydrochloride (nitrogen mustard;NM) or 2-chloroethyl ethyl sulfide (CEES) were reconstituted in dimethyl sulphoxide (DMSO). From these stock solutions, 4 mM solutions in KGM Media (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were made and immediately placed on ice prior to exposure.  A frozen aliquot of neat bis-(2-chloroethyl) sulfide (sulfur mustard;SM) in KGM was thawed and vortexed for 30 sec to generate a 4 mM stock SM solution. This solution was placed on ice immediately after generation prior to exposure.  Cells were exposed to 12.5M, 25M, 50uM, 100uM, 200uM, 400uM, 600uM, 800uM, and 1000uM NM or SM.  Cells were exposed to .1mM, .5mM, 1.0mM, 1.5mM, 2.0mM, 2.5mM, 3.0mM, 3.5 and 4.0mM CEES.  Post agent exposure cells were incubated in a chemical fume hood for one hour at 37C without CO2, and placed in tissue culture incubator at 37C with 5% CO2 for the remainder of the exposure period.  Exposure periods were 1hr, 2hr, 4hr, 8hr, 16hr, and 24hr.  Time matched controls were carried out with each exposure group.

treatment_protocol_ch1: On the day of exposure 1M stocks of either mechlorethamine hydrochloride (nitrogen mustard;NM) or 2-chloroethyl ethyl sulfide (CEES) were reconstituted in dimethyl sulphoxide (DMSO). From these stock solutions, 4 mM solutions in KGM Media (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were made and immediately placed on ice prior to exposure.  A frozen aliquot of neat bis-(2-chloroethyl) sulfide (sulfur mustard;SM) in KGM was thawed and vortexed for 30 sec to generate a 4 mM stock SM solution. This solution was placed on ice immediately after generation prior to exposure.  Cells were exposed to 12.5M, 25M, 50uM, 100uM, 200uM, 400uM, 600uM, 800uM, and 1000uM NM or SM.  Cells were exposed to .1mM, .5mM, 1.0mM, 1.5mM, 2.0mM, 2.5mM, 3.0mM, 3.5 and 4.0mM CEES.  Post agent exposure cells were incubated in a chemical fume hood for one hour at 37C without CO2, and placed in tissue culture incubator at 37C with 5% CO2 for the remainder of the exposure period.  Exposure periods were 1hr, 2hr, 4hr, 8hr, 16hr, and 24hr.  Time matched controls were carried out with each exposure group.

description: Gene expression data from NHEK_070926 NM exposure 100 uM_16h timepoint
extract_protocol_ch1: Cell lysates were collected in 400uL 1% beta-mercaptoethanol in RLT lysis buffer and processed through QIAshredder columns (QIAGEN, Valencia, CA) per the manufacturer's instructions.  Total RNA was extracted and DNase I-treated using the RNeasy Mini Kit and RNase-Free DNase Set (QIAGEN) according to the manufacturers protocol.  The quantity and quality of the RNA was determined with a NanoDrop ND-1000 UV-vis spectrophotometer (Thermo Scientific, Wilmington, DE) and an Agilent bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA) throughout sample processing.
growth_protocol_ch1: Normal human epidermal keratinocytes (NHEK) (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were seeded at a density of 1.2 x103 cells per cm2 in 25 cm2 flasks, and grown to approximately 80 % confluency.  Cells were fed 24 hours prior to exposure with appropriate amount of media for final exposure concentration volume.  Cells were grown at 37C with 5% CO2.
hyb_protocol: Spike controls were added to 15 g fragmented cRNA before hybridization (36h) using 10 g of cRNA.  Arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin before being scanned on an Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner.
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was processed for hybridization to GeneChip Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 oligonucleotide arrays (Affymetrix, Inc., Santa Clara, CA) using the BioArray Single-Round RNA Amplification and Biotin Labeling System (Enzo Life Sciences, Inc., Farmingdale, NY).  In brief, 10 g of total RNA was used to generate first strand cDNA by using a T7-linked oligo(dT) primer.  After second strand synthesis, in vitro transcription was performed with biotinylated UTP and CTP for cRNA amplification.
scan_protocol: After scanning, array images were assessed by eye to confirm scanner alignment and the absence of significant bubbles or scratches on the chip surface. The 3'/5' ratios for GAPDH and B-actin were checked for quality. BioB, BioC, BioD and CreX spike controls were also examined to determine sample quality. All arrays were scaled to a target intensity of 150 using Affymetrix GeneChip Operating System (GCOS) software.

label_protocol_ch1: At 6 or 24 hours post transfection, RNA was extracted and samples were submitted to the Hussman Institute for Human Genomics Center for Genome Technology for microarray analysis using Affymetrix Human Gene 1.0 ST Arrays. Total RNA samples were first prepared using the Ambion WT Expression Kit (cat# 4411974). Briefly, the kit generates sense-strand cDNA from total RNA using a reverse transcription priming method that specifically primes non-ribosomal RNA, including both poly(A) and non-poly(A) mRNA. Next, samples are fragmented and labeled using the Affymetrix GeneChip WT Terminal Labeling Kit (cat# 902280).

description: RNA from cell culture with different NOD2 genotypes
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen)
growth_protocol_ch1: NOD2wt and NOD2-L1007fsinsC expressing cells were generated with the FLP-IN system (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA). HEK 293 cells containing the recombination site were purchased from Invitrogen. Wildtype and mutated NOD2 were inserted to the genomic recombination site by FLP-recombinase enzyme. A control cell line was generated by transfecting an empty mock vector. All stable cell lines were selected for Hygromycin B resistance and consequently cultured in MEM + 10 % FCS + 1% Penicillin/Streptomycin + 50 g/ml Hygromycin B (Invitrogen).
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, cRNA were hybridized for 16 hr at 45C on Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array in a Affymetrix Hybridization Oven 640. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station.
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 1 ug total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner  3000.
title: NOD2wt_2h_MDP_biological replicate 3
treatment_protocol_ch1: FLP-IN HEK 293-NOD2wt, HEK 293-NOD2L1007fsinsC and HEK 293mock cells were cultivated in medium without FCS for 7 h before stimulation with 10 g/ml MDP for 0h, 2h and 6h. Cells were harvested simultaneously.

refinebio_platform: Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array (hgu133plus2)
data_processing: The data was analysed using R 2.11.1 with Bioconductor 2.4. Arrays were normalised via RMA. Differential expression was obtained from normalized expression data using nonparametric mean-variance smoothing method (see PMID 21611181). For 2h, differential expression is between treated samples and untreated samples. For 8h and 16h, differential expression is between GFP+ and GFP- arrays.
description: 8 h gene profile
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was Trizol extracted and further purified using Qiagen RNeasy Mini kit according to the manufacturer's instructions.
growth_protocol_ch1: HEK293T cells were grown in T75 in DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS, 1% Pen/Strep, 1% Sodium Pyruvate.
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, 15 ug of cRNA were hybridized for 16 hr at 45C, refer to GeneChip Expression Analysis Technical Manual (www.affymetrix.com). GeneChips were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin conjugate on an Affymetrix Fluidics Station 450
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol (reaction at 37C for 16h) from 15 ug purified RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix)
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000 7G; Pixel size: 1.56 um; Filter: 570 nm
source_name_ch1: HEK293T human embryonic epithelial kidney cell culture, untransfected_8h
title: HEK293T cell culture,8h,untransfected,biological rep 2
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cationic Lipofectamine 2000 was mixed with pEGFP-LUC to form lipoplexes. Cells were treated with lipoplexes 18h after seeding. For 2h arrays, cells were harvested 2h after delivery of lipoplexes. For 8h and 16h arrays, cells were harvested and flow separated 8h or 16h, respectively, after delivery of lipoplexes into fluorescent (GFP positive; GFPP) and non-fluorescent (GFP minus; GFPM) populations. 2h control samples were not treated with lipoplexes.

refinebio_platform: Affymetrix Human Gene 1.0 ST Array (hugene10st)
contact_department: Centre of Reproductive Medicine and Andrology
data_processing: Normalization, quality control, and output file (CHP format) generation was performed with Affymetrix Gene Expression Console v.3.1 using the Robust Multi-Chip Analysis (RMA) algorithm. Differently expressed genes were identified with Affymetrix transcriptome analysis console (TAC) v.2.0 (Affymetrix). Data were obtained using one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) and p-value correction according to Benjamini and Hochberg False Discovery Rate (FDR) for multiple testing.
description: ['RMA expression value derived from Expression Console software v.3.1', 'Human_Gene_1_0_ST_20150205_17']
extract_protocol_ch1: After 24h and 48h of transfection, cells were washed with PBS and total RNA was isolated using Total RNA Isolation Kit (Agilent). The quality of the RNA was assessed with the Bioanalyzer 2100 (Agilent) and only samples with an RNA integrity number (RIN) > 7 were included in the analysis.
growth_protocol_ch1: Human Embryonic Kidney 293 (HEK293) cells (CLS, Eppelheim, Germany) were culture in DMEM/F12 1:1 (Gibco, Carlsbad, CA, USA) containing 10% (v/v) FCS (PAA Laboratories, Pasching, Austria), 1 % penicillinstreptomycin (Gibco) and 2 mM L-Glutamine (Gibco) at 37C and 5 % CO2 (v/v).Twenty four hours prior to transfection, HEK293 cells were seeded in 24-well plates (9x10^5).
hyb_protocol: Samples were hybridized with  GeneCHip Human Gene 1.0 ST Arrays (Affymetrix) using GeneChip Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit (Affymetrix) and GeneChip Hybridization Control Kit (Affymetrix).
label_protocol_ch1: Single-stranded cDNA was generated from the amplified cRNA  using  the  Ambion  WT  Expression  Kit (Thermo Fischer Sientific)  and then fragmented and labeled with the GeneChip WT Terminal Labeling Kit (Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: Arrays  were  scanned  with  an Affymetrix GCS3000 7G using the AGCC Scan Control software.
title: RHOXF2 48h_1
treatment_protocol_ch1: For transient transfection, wild type (RHOXF1: RG217618, RHOXF2: RG205957, pCMV6-AC-GFP: PS100010, OriGene, Rockville, MD, USA)  were mixed with Lipofectamine 2000 (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA) in a 1:2,5 ratio. Cells were covered with 475 ml serum-free medium (DMEM/F12) and 25 l of the prepared DNA-lipofectamine complex was added.

title: SilX-CT.R2
treatment_protocol_ch1: We established a BAHD1 gene-specific knockdown cell line using the SilenciX siRNA delivery system (Tebu-bio). This technology is based on EBV-replication, and ensures chromosome-like replication of an episome stably expressing either a shRNA against BAHD1 (silXBAHD1) or a control shRNA (silX-CT).

refinebio_platform: Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array (hgu133plus2)
data_processing: All arrays were normalized using the GCRMA algorithm with quantile normalization composed of 100 bins using Genedata's Refiner application. Per chip normalization was performed by scaling the median of the genes called present (detection P-value < 0.04) to a value of 500.
description: ['03-Hek-500ng-1', 'Gene expression data from cultured HEK293 cells 24 hours after transfection with MosIR plasmid']
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from HEK293 or HeLa cells in a confluent 6-well dish 24 hours post-transfection using Absolutely RNA Miniprep Kit (Stratagene).
growth_protocol_ch1: HEK293 and HeLa cells were maintained in Dulbeccos Modified Eagle Medium (DMEM, Invitrogen) supplemented with 10 % FCS (Invitrogen), penicillin (100 U/mL, Invitrogen), and streptomycin (100 g/mL, Invitrogen) at 37 C and 5 % CO2 atmosphere.
hyb_protocol: Biotinylated cRNA (20 g) was fragmented by heating with magnesium (as per Affymetrix's instructions) and 15 g of fragmented cRNA was hybridized to Human U133 plus 2.0 GeneChips.
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA (5 g) from each replicate was reverse transcribed with the Affymetrix cDNA synthesis kit and cRNA was produced by in vitro transcription (IVT) by T7 RNA polymerase using the Affymetrix IVT kit as per manufacturer's instructions.

description: Sample 10
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using an RNeasy Midi Kit (75144, Qiagen, Doncaster, Australia) according to the manufacturers instructions including on-column digestion of DNA (79254, Qiagen).
growth_protocol_ch1: Producer and non-producer cells were cultivated in 1.5 L of Freestyle 293 Expression Medium in a 3 L Applikon bioreactor (Z611000220, Applikon Biotechnologies, The Netherlands). Stirrer speed was 150 rpm, temperature was maintained at 37C, pH was controlled at 7.0 and pO2 at 50% air saturation. Duplicate samples for transcriptomics (total RNA) were taken approximately 30, 43, 51 and 67 hours after inoculation of the bioreactor.
hyb_protocol: Hybridisation was performed according to the standard Illumina hybridization protocol.
label_protocol_ch1: The RNA was amplified and labelled using the Illumina TotalPrep RNA Amplification kit (IL1791, Ambion/Applied Biosystems, Austen, USA) according to the manufacturer's instructions.
scan_protocol: Scanning was performed according to the standard Illumina scanning protocol.
title: Non-producer culture - fermentation 1- time point 3
treatment_protocol_ch1: Approximately 5 x 106 cells were removed from the bioreactor and centrifuged at 200 rcf for 2 min. The supernatant was discarded and the cell pellet frozen in liquid nitrogen and stored at -80C until extraction of RNA which was performed one day after sampling.

After second strand synthesis, in vitro transcription was performed with biotinylated UTP and CTP for cRNA amplification.
scan_protocol: After scanning, array images were assessed by eye to confirm scanner alignment and the absence of significant bubbles or scratches on the chip surface. The 3'/5' ratios for GAPDH and B-actin were checked for quality. BioB, BioC, BioD and CreX spike controls were also examined to determine sample quality. All arrays were scaled to a target intensity of 150 using Affymetrix GeneChip Operating System (GCOS) software.
title: NHEK_070829 SM exposure 25 uM_8h timepoint
treatment_protocol_ch1: On the day of exposure 1M stocks of either mechlorethamine hydrochloride (nitrogen mustard;NM) or 2-chloroethyl ethyl sulfide (CEES) were reconstituted in dimethyl sulphoxide (DMSO). From these stock solutions, 4 mM solutions in KGM Media (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were made and immediately placed on ice prior to exposure.  A frozen aliquot of neat bis-(2-chloroethyl) sulfide (sulfur mustard;SM) in KGM was thawed and vortexed for 30 sec to generate a 4 mM stock SM solution. This solution was placed on ice immediately after generation prior to exposure.  Cells were exposed to 12.5M, 25M, 50uM, 100uM, 200uM, 400uM, 600uM, 800uM, and 1000uM NM or SM.  Cells were exposed to .1mM, .5mM, 1.0mM, 1.5mM, 2.0mM, 2.5mM, 3.0mM, 3.5 and 4.0mM CEES.  Post agent exposure cells were incubated in a chemical fume hood for one hour at 37C without CO2, and placed in tissue culture incubator at 37C with 5% CO2 for the remainder of the exposure period.  Exposure periods were 1hr, 2hr, 4hr, 8hr, 16hr, and 24hr.  Time matched controls were carried out with each exposure group.

data_processing: Normalization, quality control, and output file (CHP format) generation was performed with Affymetrix Gene Expression Console v.3.1 using the Robust Multi-Chip Analysis (RMA) algorithm. Differently expressed genes were identified with Affymetrix transcriptome analysis console (TAC) v.2.0 (Affymetrix). Data were obtained using one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) and p-value correction according to Benjamini and Hochberg False Discovery Rate (FDR) for multiple testing.

description: - G protein-coupled receptors (GPCR) are centrally involved in most physiological processes and are a major drug targets. They transduce extracellular signals inside the cells through at least two different mechanisms: i) the classical coupling to heterotrimeric G proteins and ii) a newly discovered -arrestin-dependent pathway. The fundamental issue of the respective impacts that these two transduction mechanisms exert on gene regulation has not been clearly addressed to date. To tackle this question, we have developed two mutants of the follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) receptors which do not couple to G proteins upon FSH activation but continue to recruit -arrestins and signal through them.

data_processing: Data extraction, QC, and GCRMA normalization were performed with BioConductor software.  Differential expression was assessed with moderated ANOVA, using the BioConductor limma package; false discovery rate (FDR) estimates were calculated using the Benjamini-Hochberg method.
description: Wild Type, no leptin, biological replicate 3
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was prepared using RNeasy Mini kit (QIAGEN) and its quality was verified in an Agilent Bioanalyzer.
growth_protocol_ch1: HEK293T/17 cells were maintained in a humidified incubator at 37 C with 5% CO2. HEK293T/17 cells were cultured in DMEM/F12 (Gibco) with non-essential amino acids, sodium pyruvate and 10% heat inactivated FBS.  Jurkat T-cells were cultured in RPMI supplemented with 10% heat inactivated FBS.  Caco-2 cells were cultured in EMEM (Gibco) supplemented with non-essential amino acids, sodium pyruvate and 20% heat inactivated FBS.  Cells were discarded after passage 25 and new cultures were started from frozen stocks. HEK293T117 cells were transiently transfected using lipofectamine 2000 per the product instructions (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA). The plasmids mLEPRb/pCDNA3 (47), mLEPRbR223/pCDNA3 (35) and LEPRbDelta65/pCDNA3 (47) were obtained from Martin Myers and have been described previously as referenced. pCDNA3 was used as a vector control. The plasmid mLEPRb/pCDNA3 was used as a template for site-directed mutagenesis to construct mLEPRb985L/pCDNA3, LEPRb1077L/pCDNA3 and mLEPRb1138L/pCDNA3.  Site-directed mutagenesis was done using the quikchange kit (Stragene/Agilent, Santa Clara, CA).    The presence of the desired mutations and the absence of other mutations were confirmed by DNA sequencing.
hyb_protocol: Three biological replicates of each sample were hybridized to Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 gene chips (Affymetrix).
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was amplified and converted to cDNA using the 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: Scanned using the GeneChip Scanner 3000 7G (AffyMetrix).
title: Wild Type, no leptin, biological replicate 3
treatment_protocol_ch1: HEK293 cells were transfected with WT LepR or Y1138L (STAT3-mutant) leptin receptor.  48 hours post-transfection cells were made quiescent by incubation in optimum plus 0.5% BSA for 3 hours.  Cells were then stimulated with 100ng of leptin or maintained in optimum plus 0.5% BSA for an additional 3 hours. Leptin was purchased from Dr. A.F. Parlow, National Hormone and Peptide Program (Torrance, CA). The STAT3 inhibitor, Stattic, the PI3K inhibitor, LY294002 and the MEK inhibitor PD98059 were purchased from EMD chemicals (Gibbstown, NJ).

contact_institute: Max Planck Institute for Molecular Genetics
data_processing: The array probe intensities from the knock-down samples were normalized together with those from the control samples using GC-RMA from the R/Bioconductor package  to give p-values from a Students t-test. The expression ratios for each probe were calculated as average of the ratios of the treated samples divided by the average of the ratios of the control samples.
description: ['Sample name: BACH1_q_2_24', 'BACH1_q_2_300ng_24h_293T.CEL', 'Gene expression data from HEK 293T cells 24h after knockdown of BACH1 with Qiagen siRNA.']
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from cultured cells at 24h and 72h post transfection using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) following the manufacturers instructions. All RNA samples were treated on-column with RNase-free DNase I, quantified by UV spectrophotometry and controlled for integrity by gel electrophoresis and capillary electrophoresis using the Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer.
growth_protocol_ch1: The human embryonic kidney cell line HEK 293T/17 (CRL-11268 from ATCC) was cultured in DMEM low glucose (Invitrogen) supplemented with 100 U/ml Penicillin/G-Streptomycin (Invitrogen) and 10% heat-inactivated FBS (Biochrom) at 37C and 5% CO2
hyb_protocol: Following integrity control using an Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer, the cRNA was fragmented and hybridized to the Affymetrix GeneChip Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 (HG-U133Plus2).
label_protocol_ch1: Reverse transcription reactions were performed with random hexamer primers and SuperScript II reverse transcriptase (Invitrogen). Complementary DNA for quantitative real-time PCR analysis was prepared from 1 g of total RNA of each sample in 20 l reactions and diluted to 12.5 ng/l equivalent of total RNA. For hybridizations on microarrays, 1 g of DNA-free total RNA from each sample was used to synthetize biotinylated cRNA using the GeneChip Expression 3' Amplification One-Cycle Target Labeling and Control Reagents kit from Affymetrix (P/N 900493).
scan_protocol: The arrays were washed, stained, and scanned by the German Resource Center for Genome Research (RZPD) following recommended protocols from Affymetrix.
title: HEK293T_BACH1-siRNA1_24h_rep2

For the mock transfections, cells were treated with HiPerFect reagent only.

contact_department: Centre of Reproductive Medicine and Andrology
data_processing: Normalization, quality control, and output file (CHP format) generation was performed with Affymetrix Gene Expression Console v.3.1 using the Robust Multi-Chip Analysis (RMA) algorithm. Differently expressed genes were identified with Affymetrix transcriptome analysis console (TAC) v.2.0 (Affymetrix). Data were obtained using one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) and p-value correction according to Benjamini and Hochberg False Discovery Rate (FDR) for multiple testing.
description: ['RMA expression value derived from Expression Console software v.3.1', 'Human_Gene_1_0_ST_20150205_20']
extract_protocol_ch1: After 24h and 48h of transfection, cells were washed with PBS and total RNA was isolated using Total RNA Isolation Kit (Agilent). The quality of the RNA was assessed with the Bioanalyzer 2100 (Agilent) and only samples with an RNA integrity number (RIN) > 7 were included in the analysis.
growth_protocol_ch1: Human Embryonic Kidney 293 (HEK293) cells (CLS, Eppelheim, Germany) were culture in DMEM/F12 1:1 (Gibco, Carlsbad, CA, USA) containing 10% (v/v) FCS (PAA Laboratories, Pasching, Austria), 1 % penicillinstreptomycin (Gibco) and 2 mM L-Glutamine (Gibco) at 37C and 5 % CO2 (v/v).Twenty four hours prior to transfection, HEK293 cells were seeded in 24-well plates (9x10^5).
hyb_protocol: Samples were hybridized with  GeneCHip Human Gene 1.0 ST Arrays (Affymetrix) using GeneChip Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit (Affymetrix) and GeneChip Hybridization Control Kit (Affymetrix).
label_protocol_ch1: Single-stranded cDNA was generated from the amplified cRNA  using  the  Ambion  WT  Expression  Kit (Thermo Fischer Sientific)  and then fragmented and labeled with the GeneChip WT Terminal Labeling Kit (Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: Arrays  were  scanned  with  an Affymetrix GCS3000 7G using the AGCC Scan Control software.

Cells were covered with 475 ml serum-free medium (DMEM/F12) and 25 l of the prepared DNA-lipofectamine complex was added.

data_processing: The data were analyzed with Gene Chip Operating Software 1.1. Represents the relative level of expression of a transcript. The median of the data is identified and each datum is weighted by how far it is from the median using One-step Tukey's Biweight Algorithm. A weighted mean is then calculated.
description: RNA from cell culture with different NOD2 genotypes
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen)
growth_protocol_ch1: NOD2wt and NOD2-L1007fsinsC expressing cells were generated with the FLP-IN system (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA). HEK 293 cells containing the recombination site were purchased from Invitrogen. Wildtype and mutated NOD2 were inserted to the genomic recombination site by FLP-recombinase enzyme. A control cell line was generated by transfecting an empty mock vector. All stable cell lines were selected for Hygromycin B resistance and consequently cultured in MEM + 10 % FCS + 1% Penicillin/Streptomycin + 50 g/ml Hygromycin B (Invitrogen).

refinebio_platform: Affymetrix Human Gene 1.0 ST Array (hugene10st)
data_processing: All samples (except ActD-treated samples) were background normalised, quantile normalised and summarised in R with RMA (BioConductor package 'oligo'). ActD-treated samples were background normalised and summarised in R with RMA, but not quantile normalised. Instead, distributions were normalised to median value of long-lived genes identified in Friedel et al. 2009 and Yang et al. 2003.

extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extraced with Trizol. RNA integrity was checked by analyzing on the 2100 Bioanalyzer. (Agilent technologies, PA, USA)
growth_protocol_ch1: HEK293RAF1:ER cells were cultured in DMEM complete w/o phenol red. Cells were serum starved over night before treatment.
hyb_protocol: The biotinylated DNA was added to a hybridization cocktail for hybridization to the Human/Mouse/Rat Gene 1.0ST Array, also containing 50pM control oligonucleotide B2, eukaryotic hybridization controls (bioB, bioC, bioD, 1,5, 5; 25 pM respectively), accordingly to the manufacturers protocol (Hybridization Wash and Stain Kit, Affymetrix). The hybridization in the Affymetrix hybridization oven 640 at 45C and 60 rpm for 16hrs, the staining and washing, processed in the Fluidics Station 450, were carried out as recommended by Affymetrix (Affymetrix Inc., Santa Clara, CA, USA).
label_protocol_ch1: For the first cycle cDNA synthesis 100 - 300ng of total RNA was used. During the following in vitro transcription reaction cRNA was obtained and used as starting material for the second cycle cDNA synthesis. The second cycle random-primed single strand DNA synthesis resulted in a product containing incorporated deoxyuridine at predefined ratios relative to thymidine WT Expression Plus Kit (Affymetrix Inc., Santa Clara, CA, USA). Subsequently, 5.5 g of this generated single-strand DNA was fragmented with a combination of uracil DNA glucosylase (UDG) and apurinic/apyrimidinic endonuclease 1 (APE1) and then labeled using the WT terminal labeling kit (Affymetrix catalogue #900671).

extract_protocol_ch1: Cell lysates were collected in 400uL 1% beta-mercaptoethanol in RLT lysis buffer and processed through QIAshredder columns (QIAGEN, Valencia, CA) per the manufacturer's instructions.  Total RNA was extracted and DNase I-treated using the RNeasy Mini Kit and RNase-Free DNase Set (QIAGEN) according to the manufacturers protocol.  The quantity and quality of the RNA was determined with a NanoDrop ND-1000 UV-vis spectrophotometer (Thermo Scientific, Wilmington, DE) and an Agilent bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA) throughout sample processing.
growth_protocol_ch1: Normal human epidermal keratinocytes (NHEK) (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were seeded at a density of 1.2 x103 cells per cm2 in 25 cm2 flasks, and grown to approximately 80 % confluency.  Cells were fed 24 hours prior to exposure with appropriate amount of media for final exposure concentration volume.  Cells were grown at 37C with 5% CO2.
hyb_protocol: Spike controls were added to 15 g fragmented cRNA before hybridization (36h) using 10 g of cRNA.  Arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin before being scanned on an Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner.
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was processed for hybridization to GeneChip Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 oligonucleotide arrays (Affymetrix, Inc., Santa Clara, CA) using the BioArray Single-Round RNA Amplification and Biotin Labeling System (Enzo Life Sciences, Inc., Farmingdale, NY).  In brief, 10 g of total RNA was used to generate first strand cDNA by using a T7-linked oligo(dT) primer.  After second strand synthesis, in vitro transcription was performed with biotinylated UTP and CTP for cRNA amplification.
scan_protocol: After scanning, array images were assessed by eye to confirm scanner alignment and the absence of significant bubbles or scratches on the chip surface. The 3'/5' ratios for GAPDH and B-actin were checked for quality. BioB, BioC, BioD and CreX spike controls were also examined to determine sample quality. All arrays were scaled to a target intensity of 150 using Affymetrix GeneChip Operating System (GCOS) software.
title: NHEK_080129 SM exposure 12.5 uM_24h timepoint
treatment_protocol_ch1: On the day of exposure 1M stocks of either mechlorethamine hydrochloride (nitrogen mustard;NM) or 2-chloroethyl ethyl sulfide (CEES) were reconstituted in dimethyl sulphoxide (DMSO). From these stock solutions, 4 mM solutions in KGM Media (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were made and immediately placed on ice prior to exposure.  A frozen aliquot of neat bis-(2-chloroethyl) sulfide (sulfur mustard;SM) in KGM was thawed and vortexed for 30 sec to generate a 4 mM stock SM solution. This solution was placed on ice immediately after generation prior to exposure.  Cells were exposed to 12.5M, 25M, 50uM, 100uM, 200uM, 400uM, 600uM, 800uM, and 1000uM NM or SM.  Cells were exposed to .1mM, .5mM, 1.0mM, 1.5mM, 2.0mM, 2.5mM, 3.0mM, 3.5 and 4.0mM CEES.  Post agent exposure cells were incubated in a chemical fume hood for one hour at 37C without CO2, and placed in tissue culture incubator at 37C with 5% CO2 for the remainder of the exposure period.  Exposure periods were 1hr, 2hr, 4hr, 8hr, 16hr, and 24hr.  Time matched controls were carried out with each exposure group.

refinebio_platform: Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array (hgu133plus2)
data_processing: Data extraction, QC, and GCRMA normalization were performed with BioConductor software.  Differential expression was assessed with moderated ANOVA, using the BioConductor limma package; false discovery rate (FDR) estimates were calculated using the Benjamini-Hochberg method.
description: Wild Type, leptin-stimulated, biological replicate 2
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was prepared using RNeasy Mini kit (QIAGEN) and its quality was verified in an Agilent Bioanalyzer.
growth_protocol_ch1: HEK293T/17 cells were maintained in a humidified incubator at 37 C with 5% CO2. HEK293T/17 cells were cultured in DMEM/F12 (Gibco) with non-essential amino acids, sodium pyruvate and 10% heat inactivated FBS.  Jurkat T-cells were cultured in RPMI supplemented with 10% heat inactivated FBS.  Caco-2 cells were cultured in EMEM (Gibco) supplemented with non-essential amino acids, sodium pyruvate and 20% heat inactivated FBS.  Cells were discarded after passage 25 and new cultures were started from frozen stocks. HEK293T117 cells were transiently transfected using lipofectamine 2000 per the product instructions (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA). The plasmids mLEPRb/pCDNA3 (47), mLEPRbR223/pCDNA3 (35) and LEPRbDelta65/pCDNA3 (47) were obtained from Martin Myers and have been described previously as referenced. pCDNA3 was used as a vector control. The plasmid mLEPRb/pCDNA3 was used as a template for site-directed mutagenesis to construct mLEPRb985L/pCDNA3, LEPRb1077L/pCDNA3 and mLEPRb1138L/pCDNA3.  Site-directed mutagenesis was done using the quikchange kit (Stragene/Agilent, Santa Clara, CA).    The presence of the desired mutations and the absence of other mutations were confirmed by DNA sequencing.
hyb_protocol: Three biological replicates of each sample were hybridized to Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 gene chips (Affymetrix).
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was amplified and converted to cDNA using the 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: Scanned using the GeneChip Scanner 3000 7G (AffyMetrix).
title: Wild Type, leptin-stimulated, biological replicate 2
treatment_protocol_ch1: HEK293 cells were transfected with WT LepR or Y1138L (STAT3-mutant) leptin receptor.  48 hours post-transfection cells were made quiescent by incubation in optimum plus 0.5% BSA for 3 hours.  Cells were then stimulated with 100ng of leptin or maintained in optimum plus 0.5% BSA for an additional 3 hours. Leptin was purchased from Dr. A.F. Parlow, National Hormone and Peptide Program (Torrance, CA). The STAT3 inhibitor, Stattic, the PI3K inhibitor, LY294002 and the MEK inhibitor PD98059 were purchased from EMD chemicals (Gibbstown, NJ).

label_protocol_ch1: At 6 or 24 hours post transfection, RNA was extracted and samples were submitted to the Hussman Institute for Human Genomics Center for Genome Technology for microarray analysis using Affymetrix Human Gene 1.0 ST Arrays. Total RNA samples were first prepared using the Ambion WT Expression Kit (cat# 4411974). Briefly, the kit generates sense-strand cDNA from total RNA using a reverse transcription priming method that specifically primes non-ribosomal RNA, including both poly(A) and non-poly(A) mRNA. Next, samples are fragmented and labeled using the Affymetrix GeneChip WT Terminal Labeling Kit (cat# 902280).

description: - G protein-coupled receptors (GPCR) are centrally involved in most physiological processes and are a major drug targets. They transduce extracellular signals inside the cells through at least two different mechanisms: i) the classical coupling to heterotrimeric G proteins and ii) a newly discovered -arrestin-dependent pathway. The fundamental issue of the respective impacts that these two transduction mechanisms exert on gene regulation has not been clearly addressed to date. To tackle this question, we have developed two mutants of the follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) receptors which do not couple to G proteins upon FSH activation but continue to recruit -arrestins and signal through them.

contact_institute: Max Planck Institute for Molecular Genetics
data_processing: The array probe intensities from the knock-down samples were normalized together with those from the control samples using GC-RMA from the R/Bioconductor package  to give p-values from a Students t-test. The expression ratios for each probe were calculated as average of the ratios of the treated samples divided by the average of the ratios of the control samples.
description: ['Sample name: BACH1_m_1_24', 'MOCK_m_1_0ng_24h_293T.CEL', 'Gene expression data from HEK 293T cells 24h after mock transfection without siRNA.']
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from cultured cells at 24h and 72h post transfection using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) following the manufacturers instructions. All RNA samples were treated on-column with RNase-free DNase I, quantified by UV spectrophotometry and controlled for integrity by gel electrophoresis and capillary electrophoresis using the Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer.
growth_protocol_ch1: The human embryonic kidney cell line HEK 293T/17 (CRL-11268 from ATCC) was cultured in DMEM low glucose (Invitrogen) supplemented with 100 U/ml Penicillin/G-Streptomycin (Invitrogen) and 10% heat-inactivated FBS (Biochrom) at 37C and 5% CO2
hyb_protocol: Following integrity control using an Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer, the cRNA was fragmented and hybridized to the Affymetrix GeneChip Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 (HG-U133Plus2).
label_protocol_ch1: Reverse transcription reactions were performed with random hexamer primers and SuperScript II reverse transcriptase (Invitrogen). Complementary DNA for quantitative real-time PCR analysis was prepared from 1 g of total RNA of each sample in 20 l reactions and diluted to 12.5 ng/l equivalent of total RNA. For hybridizations on microarrays, 1 g of DNA-free total RNA from each sample was used to synthetize biotinylated cRNA using the GeneChip Expression 3' Amplification One-Cycle Target Labeling and Control Reagents kit from Affymetrix (P/N 900493).
scan_protocol: The arrays were washed, stained, and scanned by the German Resource Center for Genome Research (RZPD) following recommended protocols from Affymetrix.
title: HEK293T_mock-transfection_24h_rep1
treatment_protocol_ch1: For transfection, ca. 18,000 cells/cm were seeded in 12-well plates together with esiRNA/HiPerFect complexes (200 ng esiRNA/6 l HiPerFect per well) or siRNA/HiPerFect complexes (300 ng siRNA/6 l HiPerFect per well) according to the HiPerFect fast-forward protocol (Qiagen). For the mock transfections, cells were treated with HiPerFect reagent only.

Complementary DNA for quantitative real-time PCR analysis was prepared from 1 g of total RNA of each sample in 20 l reactions and diluted to 12.5 ng/l equivalent of total RNA. For hybridizations on microarrays, 1 g of DNA-free total RNA from each sample was used to synthetize biotinylated cRNA using the GeneChip Expression 3' Amplification One-Cycle Target Labeling and Control Reagents kit from Affymetrix (P/N 900493).
scan_protocol: The arrays were washed, stained, and scanned by the German Resource Center for Genome Research (RZPD) following recommended protocols from Affymetrix.

For the mock transfections, cells were treated with HiPerFect reagent only.

description: Gene expression data from NHEK_070829 SM exposure 100 uM_4h timepoint
extract_protocol_ch1: Cell lysates were collected in 400uL 1% beta-mercaptoethanol in RLT lysis buffer and processed through QIAshredder columns (QIAGEN, Valencia, CA) per the manufacturer's instructions.  Total RNA was extracted and DNase I-treated using the RNeasy Mini Kit and RNase-Free DNase Set (QIAGEN) according to the manufacturers protocol.  The quantity and quality of the RNA was determined with a NanoDrop ND-1000 UV-vis spectrophotometer (Thermo Scientific, Wilmington, DE) and an Agilent bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA) throughout sample processing.
growth_protocol_ch1: Normal human epidermal keratinocytes (NHEK) (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were seeded at a density of 1.2 x103 cells per cm2 in 25 cm2 flasks, and grown to approximately 80 % confluency.  Cells were fed 24 hours prior to exposure with appropriate amount of media for final exposure concentration volume.  Cells were grown at 37C with 5% CO2.
hyb_protocol: Spike controls were added to 15 g fragmented cRNA before hybridization (36h) using 10 g of cRNA.  Arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin before being scanned on an Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner.
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was processed for hybridization to GeneChip Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 oligonucleotide arrays (Affymetrix, Inc., Santa Clara, CA) using the BioArray Single-Round RNA Amplification and Biotin Labeling System (Enzo Life Sciences, Inc., Farmingdale, NY).  In brief, 10 g of total RNA was used to generate first strand cDNA by using a T7-linked oligo(dT) primer.  After second strand synthesis, in vitro transcription was performed with biotinylated UTP and CTP for cRNA amplification.
scan_protocol: After scanning, array images were assessed by eye to confirm scanner alignment and the absence of significant bubbles or scratches on the chip surface. The 3'/5' ratios for GAPDH and B-actin were checked for quality. BioB, BioC, BioD and CreX spike controls were also examined to determine sample quality. All arrays were scaled to a target intensity of 150 using Affymetrix GeneChip Operating System (GCOS) software.
title: NHEK_070829 SM exposure 100 uM_4h timepoint
treatment_protocol_ch1: On the day of exposure 1M stocks of either mechlorethamine hydrochloride (nitrogen mustard;NM) or 2-chloroethyl ethyl sulfide (CEES) were reconstituted in dimethyl sulphoxide (DMSO). From these stock solutions, 4 mM solutions in KGM Media (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were made and immediately placed on ice prior to exposure.  A frozen aliquot of neat bis-(2-chloroethyl) sulfide (sulfur mustard;SM) in KGM was thawed and vortexed for 30 sec to generate a 4 mM stock SM solution. This solution was placed on ice immediately after generation prior to exposure.  Cells were exposed to 12.5M, 25M, 50uM, 100uM, 200uM, 400uM, 600uM, 800uM, and 1000uM NM or SM.  Cells were exposed to .1mM, .5mM, 1.0mM, 1.5mM, 2.0mM, 2.5mM, 3.0mM, 3.5 and 4.0mM CEES.  Post agent exposure cells were incubated in a chemical fume hood for one hour at 37C without CO2, and placed in tissue culture incubator at 37C with 5% CO2 for the remainder of the exposure period.  Exposure periods were 1hr, 2hr, 4hr, 8hr, 16hr, and 24hr.  Time matched controls were carried out with each exposure group.

refinebio_platform: Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array (hgu133plus2)
data_processing: The data was analysed using R  2.9.0 with Bioconductor 2.4. Arrays were normalised via RMA, and all treatments were compared to the control LA via the limma package. Benjamini-Hochberg adjusted p-values were used as significance measurement.

data_processing: The data was analysed using R 2.11.1 with Bioconductor 2.4. Arrays were normalised via RMA. For 2h, differential expression is between treated samples and untreated samples. For 8h and 16h, differential expression is between GFP+ and GFP- arrays.

scan_protocol: A confocal scanner was used to collect fluorescence signal at 3um resolution after excitation at 570 nm. The average signal from two sequential scans was calculated for each microarray feature.

description: - G protein-coupled receptors (GPCR) are centrally involved in most physiological processes and are a major drug targets. They transduce extracellular signals inside the cells through at least two different mechanisms: i) the classical coupling to heterotrimeric G proteins and ii) a newly discovered -arrestin-dependent pathway. The fundamental issue of the respective impacts that these two transduction mechanisms exert on gene regulation has not been clearly addressed to date. To tackle this question, we have developed two mutants of the follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) receptors which do not couple to G proteins upon FSH activation but continue to recruit -arrestins and signal through them.

Briefly, the kit generates sense-strand cDNA from total RNA using a reverse transcription priming method that specifically primes non-ribosomal RNA, including both poly(A) and non-poly(A) mRNA. Next, samples are fragmented and labeled using the Affymetrix GeneChip WT Terminal Labeling Kit (cat# 902280).

data_processing: Partek Genomics suite was used to process CEL files, perform normalization and QC as well as to identify differentially regulated genes between native and CD44 transfected HEK293 cells using ANOVA.
description: NA
extract_protocol_ch1: HEK293-CD44s Clone 4, expressing an average level of HA, was picked for profiling gene expression using Affymetrix Human Genome U133plus 2.0 arrays. Total RNA was prepared using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen, Germany), Microarray RNA Target Synthesis Kit T7 and RNeasy Mini-Spin Columns (Roche, Germany) and a hybridization mix was created consisting of 30 l of fragmented cRNA solution mixed with control oligonucleotide, staggered control cRNAs, herring sperm DNA, acetylated BSA and hybridization buffer in a total volume of 300 l. All kit procedures were performed according to the manufacturers instructions.
growth_protocol_ch1: For cloning and expression of human CD44 (EMBL accession number M24915) the sequence was codon optimized (Geneart, Germany) and CD44s was expressed using a pcDNA3.1(-) vector (Invitrogen, Germany). PCR was performed with a denaturation step at 94C for 2 min, followed by 30 cycles of denaturation at 94C for 30 sec, annealing at 58C for 30 sec, and extension at 68C for 45 sec, with a final extension of 7 minutes at 68C (Expand High Fidelity PCR Kit, Roche). The PCR product and the vector were digested with EcoRI/HindIII restriction endonucleases, and DNA fragments were resolved by 1% agarose gel electrophoresis,purified from gels (GFX PCR DNA and Gel Band Purification Kit) and ligated (Rapid DNA Ligation Kit, Roche). Vectors were transferred into XL-10 Gold super-competent cells (Stratagene, The Netherlands) by heat shock and transformed cells were isolated form agar plates containing 100g/ml Ampicilin. Vector DNA from transfected cells was isolated using the High Pure Plasmid Isolation Kit (Roche, Germany).
hyb_protocol: The hybridization mix was loaded onto the arrays and incubated in a roller device for 16 hrs. Hybridization solution was removed, arrays were washed, stained

ActD-treated samples were background normalised and summarised in R with RMA, but not quantile normalised. The hybridization in the Affymetrix hybridization oven 640 at 45C and 60 rpm for 16hrs, the staining and washing, processed in the Fluidics Station 450, were carried out as recommended by Affymetrix (Affymetrix Inc., Santa Clara, CA, USA).
label_protocol_ch1: For the first cycle cDNA synthesis 100 - 300ng of total RNA was used. During the following in vitro transcription reaction cRNA was obtained and used as starting material for the second cycle cDNA synthesis. The second cycle random-primed single strand DNA synthesis resulted in a product containing incorporated deoxyuridine at predefined ratios relative to thymidine WT Expression Plus Kit (Affymetrix Inc., Santa Clara, CA, USA). Subsequently, 5.5 g of this generated single-strand DNA was fragmented with a combination of uracil DNA glucosylase (UDG) and apurinic/apyrimidinic endonuclease 1 (APE1) and then labeled using the WT terminal labeling kit (Affymetrix catalogue #900671).

description: - G protein-coupled receptors (GPCR) are centrally involved in most physiological processes and are a major drug targets. They transduce extracellular signals inside the cells through at least two different mechanisms: i) the classical coupling to heterotrimeric G proteins and ii) a newly discovered -arrestin-dependent pathway. The fundamental issue of the respective impacts that these two transduction mechanisms exert on gene regulation has not been clearly addressed to date. To tackle this question, we have developed two mutants of the follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) receptors which do not couple to G proteins upon FSH activation but continue to recruit -arrestins and signal through them.

description: Sample 2
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using an RNeasy Midi Kit (75144, Qiagen, Doncaster, Australia) according to the manufacturers instructions including on-column digestion of DNA (79254, Qiagen).
growth_protocol_ch1: Producer and non-producer cells were cultivated in 1.5 L of Freestyle 293 Expression Medium in a 3 L Applikon bioreactor (Z611000220, Applikon Biotechnologies, The Netherlands). Stirrer speed was 150 rpm, temperature was maintained at 37C, pH was controlled at 7.0 and pO2 at 50% air saturation. Duplicate samples for transcriptomics (total RNA) were taken approximately 30, 43, 51 and 67 hours after inoculation of the bioreactor.
hyb_protocol: Hybridisation was performed according to the standard Illumina hybridization protocol.

treatment_protocol_ch1: Approximately 5 x 106 cells were removed from the bioreactor and centrifuged at 200 rcf for 2 min. The supernatant was discarded and the cell pellet frozen in liquid nitrogen and stored at -80C until extraction of RNA which was performed one day after sampling.

data_processing: The data was analysed using R 2.11.1 with Bioconductor 2.4. Arrays were normalised via RMA. Differential expression was obtained from normalized expression data using nonparametric mean-variance smoothing method (see PMID 21611181). For 2h, differential expression is between treated samples and untreated samples. For 8h and 16h, differential expression is between GFP+ and GFP- arrays.

For 2h arrays, cells were harvested 2h after delivery of lipoplexes. For 8h and 16h arrays, cells were harvested and flow separated 8h or 16h, respectively, after delivery of lipoplexes into fluorescent (GFP positive; GFPP) and non-fluorescent (GFP minus; GFPM) populations. 2h control samples were not treated with lipoplexes.

contact_institute: U.S. Army Medical Research Institute of Chemical Defense
data_processing: Raw signal intensities were imported into Partek Genomics Solutions v6.5 (Partek, St. Louis, MO) and normalized using the robust multi-array averaging (RMA) algorithm.
description: Gene expression data from NHEK_070829 SM exposure control 0 uM_2h timepoint
extract_protocol_ch1: Cell lysates were collected in 400uL 1% beta-mercaptoethanol in RLT lysis buffer and processed through QIAshredder columns (QIAGEN, Valencia, CA) per the manufacturer's instructions.  Total RNA was extracted and DNase I-treated using the RNeasy Mini Kit and RNase-Free DNase Set (QIAGEN) according to the manufacturers protocol.  The quantity and quality of the RNA was determined with a NanoDrop ND-1000 UV-vis spectrophotometer (Thermo Scientific, Wilmington, DE) and an Agilent bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA) throughout sample processing.
growth_protocol_ch1: Normal human epidermal keratinocytes (NHEK) (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were seeded at a density of 1.2 x103 cells per cm2 in 25 cm2 flasks, and grown to approximately 80 % confluency.  Cells were fed 24 hours prior to exposure with appropriate amount of media for final exposure concentration volume.  Cells were grown at 37C with 5% CO2.
hyb_protocol: Spike controls were added to 15 g fragmented cRNA before hybridization (36h) using 10 g of cRNA.  Arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin before being scanned on an Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner.
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was processed for hybridization to GeneChip Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 oligonucleotide arrays (Affymetrix, Inc., Santa Clara, CA) using the BioArray Single-Round RNA Amplification and Biotin Labeling System (Enzo Life Sciences, Inc., Farmingdale, NY).  In brief, 10 g of total RNA was used to generate first strand cDNA by using a T7-linked oligo(dT) primer.  After second strand synthesis, in vitro transcription was performed with biotinylated UTP and CTP for cRNA amplification.
scan_protocol: After scanning, array images were assessed by eye to confirm scanner alignment and the absence of significant bubbles or scratches on the chip surface. The 3'/5' ratios for GAPDH and B-actin were checked for quality. BioB, BioC, BioD and CreX spike controls were also examined to determine sample quality. All arrays were scaled to a target intensity of 150 using Affymetrix GeneChip Operating System (GCOS) software.
source_name_ch1: NHEK_070829 SM exposure control 0 uM_2h timepoint
title: NHEK_070829 SM exposure control 0 uM_2h timepoint
treatment_protocol_ch1: On the day of exposure 1M stocks of either mechlorethamine hydrochloride (nitrogen mustard;NM) or 2-chloroethyl ethyl sulfide (CEES) were reconstituted in dimethyl sulphoxide (DMSO). From these stock solutions, 4 mM solutions in KGM Media (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were made and immediately placed on ice prior to exposure.  A frozen aliquot of neat bis-(2-chloroethyl) sulfide (sulfur mustard;SM) in KGM was thawed and vortexed for 30 sec to generate a 4 mM stock SM solution. This solution was placed on ice immediately after generation prior to exposure.  Cells were exposed to 12.5M, 25M, 50uM, 100uM, 200uM, 400uM, 600uM, 800uM, and 1000uM NM or SM.  Cells were exposed to .1mM, .5mM, 1.0mM, 1.5mM, 2.0mM, 2.5mM, 3.0mM, 3.5 and 4.0mM CEES.  Post agent exposure cells were incubated in a chemical fume hood for one hour at 37C without CO2, and placed in tissue culture incubator at 37C with 5% CO2 for the remainder of the exposure period.  Exposure periods were 1hr, 2hr, 4hr, 8hr, 16hr, and 24hr.  Time matched controls were carried out with each exposure group.

description: RNA from cell culture with different NOD2 genotypes
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen)
growth_protocol_ch1: NOD2wt and NOD2-L1007fsinsC expressing cells were generated with the FLP-IN system (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA). HEK 293 cells containing the recombination site were purchased from Invitrogen. Wildtype and mutated NOD2 were inserted to the genomic recombination site by FLP-recombinase enzyme. A control cell line was generated by transfecting an empty mock vector. All stable cell lines were selected for Hygromycin B resistance and consequently cultured in MEM + 10 % FCS + 1% Penicillin/Streptomycin + 50 g/ml Hygromycin B (Invitrogen).

data_processing: The data was analysed using R 2.9.0 with Bioconductor 2.4. Arrays were normalised via RMA, and all treatments were compared to the control LA via the limma package. Benjamini-Hochberg adjusted p-values were used as significance measurement.
description: 24 h gene profile of untreated HEK293T cells.
extract_protocol_ch1: Trizol extraction of total RNA was performed according to the manufacturer's (Invitrogen) instructions.
growth_protocol_ch1: HEK293T cells were grown in T75 in DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS, 1% Pen/Strep, 1% Sodium Pyruvate.
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, 15 ug of cRNA were hybridized for 16 hr at 45C, refer to GeneChip Expression Analysis Technical Manual (www.affymetrix.com). GeneChips were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin conjugate on an Affymetrix Fluidics Station 450.
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol (reaction at 37C for 16h) from 15 ug total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000 7G; Pixel size: 1.56 um; Filter: 570 nm.

title: HEK293T cell culture, untreated, biological rep 2
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cationic PEI polymer mixed with pEGFP-LUC to form polyplexes. Cells were treated with polyplexes 18 h after seeding and flow separated after another 24 h.

refinebio_platform: Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array (hgu133plus2)
contact_institute: Institute of Clinical Molecular Biology Christian-Albrechts-Universitt Kiel
data_processing: The data were analyzed with Gene Chip Operating Software 1.1. Represents the relative level of expression of a transcript. The median of the data is identified and each datum is weighted by how far it is from the median using One-step Tukey's Biweight Algorithm. A weighted mean is then calculated.
description: RNA from cell culture with different NOD2 genotypes
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen)
growth_protocol_ch1: NOD2wt and NOD2-L1007fsinsC expressing cells were generated with the FLP-IN system (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA). HEK 293 cells containing the recombination site were purchased from Invitrogen. Wildtype and mutated NOD2 were inserted to the genomic recombination site by FLP-recombinase enzyme. A control cell line was generated by transfecting an empty mock vector. All stable cell lines were selected for Hygromycin B resistance and consequently cultured in MEM + 10 % FCS + 1% Penicillin/Streptomycin + 50 g/ml Hygromycin B (Invitrogen).
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, cRNA were hybridized for 16 hr at 45C on Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array in a Affymetrix Hybridization Oven 640. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station.
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 1 ug total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner  3000.
title: NOD2wt_0h_MDP_biological replicate 1
treatment_protocol_ch1: FLP-IN HEK 293-NOD2wt, HEK 293-NOD2L1007fsinsC and HEK 293mock cells were cultivated in medium without FCS for 7 h before stimulation with 10 g/ml MDP for 0h, 2h and 6h. Cells were harvested simultaneously.

description: NA
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA (including small RNAs) was extracted using Trizol (Invitrogen) and the aqueous phase was purified with RNeasy Mini kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturers protocols.
growth_protocol_ch1: HEK293T cells were grown in DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS and 1X PSG.
hyb_protocol: The cRNA products were fragmented to 200 nucleotides or less, heated at 99 degrees C for 5 min and hybridized for 16 h at 45 degrees C. The microarrays were then washed at low (6X SSPE) and high (100mM MES, 0.1M NaCl) stringency and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin. Fluorescence was amplified by adding biotinylated anti-streptavidin and an additional aliquot of streptavidin-phycoerythrin stain.
label_protocol_ch1: Second-strand cDNA synthesis was followed by in vitro transcription for linear amplification of each transcript and incorporation of biotinylated CTP and UTP.
scan_protocol: A confocal scanner was used to collect fluorescence signal at 3um resolution after excitation at 570 nm. The average signal from two sequential scans was calculated for each microarray feature.
title: HEK293T_miR-132_FSK4hr_rep2
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cells were reverse transfected with RNA using Lipofectamine2000 at a final concentration of 50 nM.  Approximately 72hrs post-transfection, cells were treated with 15uM forskolin for 0, 1 or 4 hrs.

data_processing: The data were first processed with GCOS1.4 using Affymetrix default analysis settings. The trimmed mean target intensity of each array was arbitrarily set to 1000. Intensities obtained in CHP file generated by GCOS were normalized using an adaptive variance-stabilizing quantile normalization (Munson, P.J., GeneLogic Workshop of Low Level Analysis of Affymetrix GeneChip Data, 2001, software available at http://abs.cit.nih.gov/geneexpression.html).

refinebio_platform: Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 Array (hgu133plus2)
contact_institute: U.S. Army Medical Research Institute of Chemical Defense
data_processing: Raw signal intensities were imported into Partek Genomics Solutions v6.5 (Partek, St. Louis, MO) and normalized using the robust multi-array averaging (RMA) algorithm.
description: Gene expression data from NHEK_070829 SM exposure 50 uM_24h timepoint
extract_protocol_ch1: Cell lysates were collected in 400uL 1% beta-mercaptoethanol in RLT lysis buffer and processed through QIAshredder columns (QIAGEN, Valencia, CA) per the manufacturer's instructions.  Total RNA was extracted and DNase I-treated using the RNeasy Mini Kit and RNase-Free DNase Set (QIAGEN) according to the manufacturers protocol.  The quantity and quality of the RNA was determined with a NanoDrop ND-1000 UV-vis spectrophotometer (Thermo Scientific, Wilmington, DE) and an Agilent bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA) throughout sample processing.
growth_protocol_ch1: Normal human epidermal keratinocytes (NHEK) (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were seeded at a density of 1.2 x103 cells per cm2 in 25 cm2 flasks, and grown to approximately 80 % confluency.  Cells were fed 24 hours prior to exposure with appropriate amount of media for final exposure concentration volume.  Cells were grown at 37C with 5% CO2.
hyb_protocol: Spike controls were added to 15 g fragmented cRNA before hybridization (36h) using 10 g of cRNA.  Arrays were washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin before being scanned on an Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner.
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was processed for hybridization to GeneChip Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 oligonucleotide arrays (Affymetrix, Inc., Santa Clara, CA) using the BioArray Single-Round RNA Amplification and Biotin Labeling System (Enzo Life Sciences, Inc., Farmingdale, NY).  In brief, 10 g of total RNA was used to generate first strand cDNA by using a T7-linked oligo(dT) primer.  After second strand synthesis, in vitro transcription was performed with biotinylated UTP and CTP for cRNA amplification.
scan_protocol: After scanning, array images were assessed by eye to confirm scanner alignment and the absence of significant bubbles or scratches on the chip surface. The 3'/5' ratios for GAPDH and B-actin were checked for quality. BioB, BioC, BioD and CreX spike controls were also examined to determine sample quality. All arrays were scaled to a target intensity of 150 using Affymetrix GeneChip Operating System (GCOS) software.
title: NHEK_070829 SM exposure 50 uM_24h timepoint
treatment_protocol_ch1: On the day of exposure 1M stocks of either mechlorethamine hydrochloride (nitrogen mustard;NM) or 2-chloroethyl ethyl sulfide (CEES) were reconstituted in dimethyl sulphoxide (DMSO). From these stock solutions, 4 mM solutions in KGM Media (Lonza, Walkersville, MD) were made and immediately placed on ice prior to exposure.  A frozen aliquot of neat bis-(2-chloroethyl) sulfide (sulfur mustard;SM) in KGM was thawed and vortexed for 30 sec to generate a 4 mM stock SM solution. This solution was placed on ice immediately after generation prior to exposure.  Cells were exposed to 12.5M, 25M, 50uM, 100uM, 200uM, 400uM, 600uM, 800uM, and 1000uM NM or SM.  Cells were exposed to .1mM, .5mM, 1.0mM, 1.5mM, 2.0mM, 2.5mM, 3.0mM, 3.5 and 4.0mM CEES.  Post agent exposure cells were incubated in a chemical fume hood for one hour at 37C without CO2, and placed in tissue culture incubator at 37C with 5% CO2 for the remainder of the exposure period.  Exposure periods were 1hr, 2hr, 4hr, 8hr, 16hr, and 24hr.  Time matched controls were carried out with each exposure group.

data_processing: ["Affymetrix CEL files were extracted and their data normalized with the Partek GS 6.6 platform. description: SAMPLE 9
extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were lysed using RNAeasy mini kit (Qiagen), according to manufacturer's instructions. Genomic DNA was first removed by DNAse treatment on the column, and then, additionally, after total RNA was isolated, using DNase Turbo kit (Ambion), followed by additional round of cleaning through RNAeasy columns.
growth_protocol_ch1: HEK293 cells grown in DMEM, 10%FBS, 37C, 5% CO2
hyb_protocol: 17hrs at 45 C with rotation (60rpm) as described by Affymetrix in their GeneChip Expression Analysis Technical Manual
label_protocol_ch1: The Ambion Expression WT kit was used as described in the manufacturer's manual.
scan_protocol: Using Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000 7G and default parameters described by the manufacturer in their GeneChip Expression Analysis Technical Manual
title: shCTRL, bio. replicate 3
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cells were transfected in 60mm dishes using 4g DNA, 10l Lipofectamine 2000, in total 4.5ml  Optimem-MEM1. Origene's pRS-RFP-C plasmids encoding shRNAs against UBE4B and LSD1, or non-targeting control (CTRL) were used for knockdown. Cells were knocked down for 78h before lysis.

refinebio_platform: Affymetrix Human Gene 1.0 ST Array (hugene10st)
contact_department: Centre of Reproductive Medicine and Andrology
data_processing: Normalization, quality control, and output file (CHP format) generation was performed with Affymetrix Gene Expression Console v.3.1 using the Robust Multi-Chip Analysis (RMA) algorithm. Differently expressed genes were identified with Affymetrix transcriptome analysis console (TAC) v.2.0 (Affymetrix). Data were obtained using one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) and p-value correction according to Benjamini and Hochberg False Discovery Rate (FDR) for multiple testing.
description: ['RMA expression value derived from Expression Console software v.3.1', 'Human_Gene_1_0_ST_20150205_6']
extract_protocol_ch1: After 24h and 48h of transfection, cells were washed with PBS and total RNA was isolated using Total RNA Isolation Kit (Agilent). The quality of the RNA was assessed with the Bioanalyzer 2100 (Agilent) and only samples with an RNA integrity number (RIN) > 7 were included in the analysis.
growth_protocol_ch1: Human Embryonic Kidney 293 (HEK293) cells (CLS, Eppelheim, Germany) were culture in DMEM/F12 1:1 (Gibco, Carlsbad, CA, USA) containing 10% (v/v) FCS (PAA Laboratories, Pasching, Austria), 1 % penicillinstreptomycin (Gibco) and 2 mM L-Glutamine (Gibco) at 37C and 5 % CO2 (v/v).Twenty four hours prior to transfection, HEK293 cells were seeded in 24-well plates (9x10^5).
hyb_protocol: Samples were hybridized with  GeneCHip Human Gene 1.0 ST Arrays (Affymetrix) using GeneChip Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit (Affymetrix) and GeneChip Hybridization Control Kit (Affymetrix).
label_protocol_ch1: Single-stranded cDNA was generated from the amplified cRNA  using  the  Ambion  WT  Expression  Kit (Thermo Fischer Sientific)  and then fragmented and labeled with the GeneChip WT Terminal Labeling Kit (Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: Arrays  were  scanned  with  an Affymetrix GCS3000 7G using the AGCC Scan Control software.
title: control 24h_2
treatment_protocol_ch1: For transient transfection, wild type (RHOXF1: RG217618, RHOXF2: RG205957, pCMV6-AC-GFP: PS100010, OriGene, Rockville, MD, USA)  were mixed with Lipofectamine 2000 (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA) in a 1:2,5 ratio. Cells were covered with 475 ml serum-free medium (DMEM/F12) and 25 l of the prepared DNA-lipofectamine complex was added.
